item.title: Tara add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I don't want to die without any scars." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Tara add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Tara add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The things you used to own, now they own you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Tara add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Tara add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Tara add a quote by George Clinton
item.description: "Free your mind... and your ass will follow." -- George Clinton

item.title: Tara add a quote by Ayn Rand
Tara add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Peace? I hate the word as I hate hell and all Montagues." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tara add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I say let me never be complete, I say may I never be content,I say deliver me from Swedish furniture, I say deliver me from clever arts, I say deliver me from clear skin and perfect teeth,I say you have to give up! I say evolve, and let the chips fall where they may!" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Tara add a quote by Cowboy Wisdom
item.description: "The best sermons are lived, not preached." -- Cowboy Wisdom

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mary Anne Radmacher
item.description: "Courage does not always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow." -- Mary Anne Radmacher

item.title: Tara add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tara add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I read," I say. "I study and read. I bet I've read everything you read. Don't think I haven't. I consume libraries. I wear out spines and ROM-drives. I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." My instincts concerning syntax and mechanics are better than your own, I can tell, with all due respect. But it transcends the mechanics. I'm not a machine. I feel and believe. I have opinions. Some of them are interesting. I could, if you'd let me, talk and talk." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tara add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Because here's something else that's weird but true: in the day-to day trenches of adult life, there is actually no such thing as atheism. There is no such thing as not worshipping. Everybody worships. The only choice we get is what to worship. And the compelling reason for maybe choosing some sort of god or spiritual-type thing to worship -- be it JC or Allah, be it YHWH or the Wiccan Mother Goddess, or the Four Noble Truths, or some inviolable set of ethical principles -- is that pretty much anything else you worship will eat you alive. If you worship money and things, if they are where you tap real meaning in life, then you will never have enough, never feel you have enough. It's the truth. Worship your body and beauty and sexual allure and you will always feel ugly. And when time and age start showing, you will die a million deaths before they finally grieve you. On one level, we all know this stuff already. It's been codified as myths, proverbs, clichés, epigrams, parables; the skeleton of every great story. The whole trick is keeping the truth up front in daily consciousness." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tara add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I was not a lovable child, and I'd grown into a deeply unlovable adult. Draw a picture of my soul, and it'd be a scribble with fangs." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Tara add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Tara add a quote by Kami Garcia
item.description: "I stared at the creased map on my wall, the thin green line connecting all the places I had read about. There they were, all the cities of my imaginary future, held together with tape and marker and pins. In six months, a lot had changed. There was no thin green line that could lead me to my future anymore. Just a girl." -- Kami Garcia

item.title: Tara add a quote by Virgil
item.description: "If I cannot bend Heaven, I will move Hell" -- Virgil

item.title: Tara add a quote by Leeza Gibbons
item.description: "Let go or be dragged." -- Leeza Gibbons

item.title: Tara add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is only one success-to be able to spend life in your own way." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Tara add a quote by Dale Carnegia
item.description: "Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy." -- Dale Carnegia

item.title: Tara add a quote by Stephen R. Covey
item.description: "The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities." -- Stephen R. Covey

item.title: Tara add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "People have only as much liberty as they have the intelligence to want and the courage to take." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tara add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Tara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tara add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Tara add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso
